name: Firestorm, the Nuclear Man Quiz / Test | Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was the name of the scientist who shared Firestorm's body?
questions.explanation:
Martin Stein.

	Stein was a Nobel Prize-winning scientist who was caught with Raymond in the nuclear accident. The conversations between the two served to distinguish the character in Firestorm's first series.

New York City.

	Raymond defended New York City, instead of being based in fictional towns like many DC superheroes. Jason Rusch, the second Firestorm, makes his home in Detroit, Michigan.

questions.text: The first "Firestorm" series was canceled after issue #6.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The primary series was canceled in 1978 after issue #5, but issue #6 was included in "Canceled Comics Cavalcade". A new series was launched in 1982 and lasted until 1990. A third series, with a new Firestorm, was started in 2004.

questions.text: Which superhero was created as a love interest for Firestorm?
questions.explanation:
Firehawk.

	Firehawk was created in 1984 to provide the series with some romance. She was seen in the most recent Firestorm series, and has also been romantically linked with the time-traveling superhero Booster Gold.

questions.text: Where did Ronnie Raymond attend college?
questions.explanation:
Pittsburgh.

	While in college, Raymond took classes from Ray Palmer, also known as The Atom. Gaining an understanding of chemistry, Raymond thought, would serve him well in his career as Firestorm.

questions.text: Which one of these villains is NOT primarily a Firestorm villain?
questions.explanation:
Abra Kadabra.

	Abra Kadabra is primarily a Flash villain, while all the rest are most closely associated with Firestorm. Abra Kadabra is a time-traveling scientist who went back in time to show off his high-tech gadgets and win money and fame for himself.

questions.text: In 2004, a new Firestorm appeared. What was his name?
questions.explanation:
Jason Rusch.

	Jason Rusch is a young African-American man living and operating out of Detroit, Michigan. His father was abusive, and had lost his hand in an industrial accident.

questions.text: Raymond a part of the superhero-for-hire team The Power Company.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The Power Company was a short-lived band of superheroes who worked for money. Other members included Josiah Power, Striker Z and Sapphire.

questions.text: Raymond learned that he, as Firestorm, was an Elemental. Who is NOT an Elemental?
questions.explanation:
Jakeem Thunder.

	Jakeen Thunder was one of the people to control the Badhnesian Hex Bolt originally commanded by Johnny Thunder. He has been a member of the Justice Society of America, usually teaming up with Star Girl.

questions.text: What deadly disease did Raymond fight off?
questions.explanation:
Leukemia.

	Raymond came down with leukemia, but was cured by a super powered Doctor Stein in Extreme Justice #5. Extreme Justice was a spin off of the well-known Justice League of America, and lasted eighteen issues.
